data.prayer: Jesus, for those distressed and afraid in Hardwar, Uttarakhand, India, show them today that you give peace at all times and in every situation.
data.verse: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways. The Lord be with you all.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Hardwar, Uttarakhand, India

data.prayer: Father, you said, "The earth belongs to Me and all that is in it". Please, call Hardwar, Uttarakhand, India into obedience and eternal life.
data.verse: The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness; the world, and those who dwell therein.

data.prayer: Spirit, make the church in Hardwar, Uttarakhand, India humble and willing to hear the sometimes hard voices of prophets bringing the light of truth on them.
data.verse: So have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?

data.prayer: Father, we ask for networks of simple churches in every city in the county of Hardwar, like Paul planted in Corinth and Ephesus.
data.verse: The churches in the province of Asia send you greetings. Aquila and Priscilla greet you warmly in the Lord, and so does the church that meets at their house.

data.prayer: Jesus, I pray that all the Jat Deswal people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Jat Deswal people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Jat Deswal people is yours.
Spirit, renew the call of John the Baptist in the county of Hardwar. Send out bold servants who will call all to repent.
data.verse: Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

data.prayer: Jesus, teach the believers in the county of Hardwar that love for you and obedience to you are connected.
data.verse: If you love me, keep my commands.

data.prayer: Spirit, encourage every believer in Hardwar, Uttarakhand, India to do the work of an evangelist with their friends and neighbors.
data.verse: But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist

location.name: Hardwar
location.people_groups_list: Jat Dehia (Hindu traditions), Jat Gil (Muslim traditions), Jat Ghatwal (Muslim traditions), Jat Dalal (Muslim traditions), Jat Jakhar (Hindu traditions)
